speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Satis quid sufficit.

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: I praise God for you, sir. Your reasons at

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: dinner have been sharp and sententious, pleasant

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: without scurrility, witty without affection, audacious

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: without impudency, learned without opinion,

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: and strange without heresy. I did converse this

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: quondam day with a companion of the King’s, who

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: is intituled, nominated, or called Don Adriano de

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: Armado.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Novi hominem tanquam te. His humor

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: is lofty, his discourse peremptory, his tongue filed,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: his eye ambitious, his gait majestical, and his general

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: behavior vain, ridiculous, and thrasonical. He is

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: too picked, too spruce, too affected, too odd, as it

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: were, too peregrinate, as I may call it.

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: A most singular and choice epithet.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: He draweth out the thread of his verbosity

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: finer than the staple of his argument. I abhor

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: such fanatical phantasimes, such insociable and

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: point-devise companions, such rackers of orthography,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: as to speak “dout,” fine, when he should

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: say “doubt”; “det” when he should pronounce

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: “debt”—d, e, b, t, not d, e, t. He clepeth a calf

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: “cauf,” half “hauf,” neighbor vocatur “nebor”;

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: neigh abbreviated ne. This is abhominable—which

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: he would call “abominable.” It insinuateth me of

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: insanie. Ne intelligis, domine? To make frantic,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: lunatic.

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: Laus Deo, bone intelligo.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Bone? Bone for bene? Priscian a little

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: scratched; ’twill serve.

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: Videsne quis venit?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Video, et gaudeo.

speaker: ARMADO
text: Chirrah.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Quare “chirrah,” not “sirrah”?

speaker: ARMADO
text: Men of peace, well encountered.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Most military sir, salutation.

speaker: BOY
text: They have been at a great feast

speaker: BOY
text: of languages and stolen the scraps.

speaker: COSTARD
text: O, they have lived long on the

speaker: COSTARD
text: almsbasket of words. I marvel thy master hath not

speaker: COSTARD
text: eaten thee for a word, for thou art not so long by the

speaker: COSTARD
text: head as honorificabilitudinitatibus. Thou art easier

speaker: COSTARD
text: swallowed than a flapdragon.

speaker: BOY
text: Peace, the peal begins.

speaker: ARMADO
text: Monsieur, are you not

speaker: ARMADO
text: lettered?

speaker: BOY
text: Yes, yes, he teaches boys the hornbook.—What is

speaker: BOY
text: a, b spelled backward, with the horn on his head?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Ba, pueritia, with a horn added.

speaker: BOY
text: Ba, most silly sheep, with a horn.—You hear his

speaker: BOY
text: learning.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Quis, quis, thou consonant?

speaker: BOY
text: The last of the five vowels, if you repeat them; or

speaker: BOY
text: the fifth, if I.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: I will repeat them: a, e, i—

speaker: BOY
text: The sheep. The other two concludes it: o, u.

speaker: ARMADO
text: Now by the salt wave of the Mediterraneum,

speaker: ARMADO
text: a sweet touch, a quick venue of wit! Snip, snap,

speaker: ARMADO
text: quick and home. It rejoiceth my intellect. True

speaker: ARMADO
text: wit.

speaker: BOY
text: Offered by a child to an old man—which is

speaker: BOY
text: wit-old.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: What is the figure? What is the figure?

speaker: BOY
text: Horns.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Thou disputes like an infant. Go whip thy

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: gig.

speaker: BOY
text: Lend me your horn to make one, and I will whip

speaker: BOY
text: about your infamy—unum cita—a gig of a cuckold’s

speaker: BOY
text: horn.

speaker: COSTARD
text: An I had but one penny in the world, thou

speaker: COSTARD
text: shouldst have it to buy gingerbread! Hold, there is

speaker: COSTARD
text: the very remuneration I had of thy master, thou

speaker: COSTARD
text: halfpenny purse of wit, thou pigeon egg of discretion.

speaker: COSTARD
text:
He
                 
                gives
                 
                him
                 
                money
                .
               O, an the heavens were

speaker: COSTARD
text: so pleased that thou wert but my bastard, what a

speaker: COSTARD
text: joyful father wouldest thou make me! Go to, thou

speaker: COSTARD
text: hast it ad dunghill, at the fingers’ ends, as they say.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Oh, I smell false Latin! Dunghill for

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: unguem.

speaker: ARMADO
text: Arts-man, preambulate. We will be singuled

speaker: ARMADO
text: from the barbarous. Do you not educate youth at

speaker: ARMADO
text: the charge-house on the top of the mountain?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Or mons, the hill.

speaker: ARMADO
text: At your sweet pleasure, for the mountain.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: I do, sans question.

speaker: ARMADO
text: Sir, it is the King’s most sweet pleasure and

speaker: ARMADO
text: affection to congratulate the Princess at her pavilion

speaker: ARMADO
text: in the posteriors of this day, which the rude

speaker: ARMADO
text: multitude call the afternoon.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: “The posterior of the day,” most generous

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: sir, is liable, congruent, and measurable for

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: “the afternoon”; the word is well culled, chose,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: sweet, and apt, I do assure you, sir, I do assure.

speaker: ARMADO
text: Sir, the King is a noble gentleman, and my

speaker: ARMADO
text: familiar, I do assure you, very good friend. For

speaker: ARMADO
text: what is inward between us, let it pass. I do beseech

speaker: ARMADO
text: thee, remember thy courtesy; I beseech thee apparel

speaker: ARMADO
text: thy head. And among other important and most

speaker: ARMADO
text: serious designs, and of great import indeed, too—

speaker: ARMADO
text: but let that pass; for I must tell thee, it will please his

speaker: ARMADO
text: Grace, by the world, sometimes to lean upon my

speaker: ARMADO
text: poor shoulder and with his royal finger thus dally

speaker: ARMADO
text: with my excrement, with my mustachio—but,

speaker: ARMADO
text: sweetheart, let that pass. By the world, I recount no

speaker: ARMADO
text: fable! Some certain special honors it pleaseth his

speaker: ARMADO
text: Greatness to impart to Armado, a soldier, a man of

speaker: ARMADO
text: travel, that hath seen the world—but let that pass.

speaker: ARMADO
text: The very all of all is—but sweetheart, I do implore

speaker: ARMADO
text: secrecy—that the King would have me present the

speaker: ARMADO
text: Princess, sweet chuck, with some delightful ostentation,

speaker: ARMADO
text: or show, or pageant, or antic, or firework.

speaker: ARMADO
text: Now, understanding that the curate and your sweet

speaker: ARMADO
text: self are good at such eruptions and sudden breaking

speaker: ARMADO
text: out of mirth, as it were, I have acquainted you

speaker: ARMADO
text: withal to the end to crave your assistance.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Sir, you shall present before her the Nine

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Worthies.—Sir Nathaniel, as concerning some

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: entertainment of time, some show in the posterior

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: of this day, to be rendered by our assistance, the

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: King’s command, and this most gallant, illustrate,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: and learned gentleman, before the Princess—I say,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: none so fit as to present the Nine Worthies.

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: Where will you find men worthy enough to

speaker: NATHANIEL
text: present them?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Joshua, yourself; myself; and this gallant

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: gentleman, Judas Maccabaeus. This swain, because

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: of his great limb or joint, shall pass Pompey

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: the Great; the page, Hercules—

speaker: ARMADO
text: Pardon, sir—error. He is not quantity

speaker: ARMADO
text: enough for that Worthy’s thumb; he is not so big as

speaker: ARMADO
text: the end of his club!

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Shall I have audience? He shall present

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Hercules in minority. His enter and exit shall be

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: strangling a snake; and I will have an apology for

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: that purpose.

speaker: BOY
text: An excellent device. So, if any of the audience

speaker: BOY
text: hiss, you may cry “Well done, Hercules, now thou

speaker: BOY
text: crushest the snake.” That is the way to make an

speaker: BOY
text: offense gracious, though few have the grace to do it.

speaker: ARMADO
text: For the rest of the Worthies?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: I will play three myself.

speaker: BOY
text: Thrice-worthy gentleman!

speaker: ARMADO
text: Shall I tell you a thing?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: We attend.

speaker: ARMADO
text: We will have, if this fadge not, an antic. I

speaker: ARMADO
text: beseech you, follow.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Via, goodman Dull. Thou hast spoken no

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: word all this while.

speaker: DULL
text: Nor understood none neither, sir.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Allons! We will employ thee.

speaker: DULL
text: I’ll make one in a dance, or so; or I will play on

speaker: DULL
text: the tabor to the Worthies and let them dance the

speaker: DULL
text: hay.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Most dull, honest Dull. To our sport!

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text: Away.
